review: My parents wanted a way to access services such as Netlfix and Hulu plus in their room, but they weren't ready to replace their perfectly good tv with a smart tv. I had been planning on getting them a Roku since I have one myself, but decided to wait for this little stick to be released before getting one for my parents. it barely takes up any room and since the tv it's plugged into has a powered USB port, it is able to power itself using the tv. Setup was a breeze and adding channels went through very smoothly. My parents can manage the UI just fine once I got all their favourite channels set up for them.Pros:- easy setup- small footprint barely takes up any room- remote is powered by bluetooth so you don't need a line of sight to the Roku- remote is straightforward to operateCons:- the loading screen sits there for ages before the Roku is finally ready to be used. It'll look like it's infinitely looping those "dancing" Roku letters, but it'll get there eventually. However once on the UI is smooth and fluidOther thoughts:- even though the stick it hidden behind the tv, I like the purple colour- I would've preferred that dedicated Blockbuster video button on the remote be replaced with something else- the remote is a bit fatter than I expected based on pictures, but it isn't by any means unwieldy
author: Dan

review: Have a PS3 and a Chromecast, but wanted to see if this could fit into my life somehow. The PS3 is a little clunky with the controller and navigation. The Chromecast is a little too minimalist with no interface or controller. The Roku is the perfect marriage of everything. Interface is fantastic, really streamlines everything together. The remote is the killer feature here that makes it all worth it. All the apps are fun to explore and play around with. The Chromecast has gone on the bedroom TV. The Roku earns the spot for the main TV. We love it. Picture quality is great. To echo others, yes, it's a little slow, but not terribly so.
